Reviews.Title: Excellent value with tons of features BUT get the right card!
Reviews.Author: R. Wilson
Reviews.Content: This camera is a great value, with many shooting options and a compact size. I intend to use it for snapshots and I'm evaluating it as such.The main reason I'm writing this review is to share some information about its video capabilities:- The camera can record audio but does not have a speaker, so in-camera playback will not have audio.- This camera does not include an XD memory card, and to store anything beyond the pathetic internal memory you will need to purchase one. XD cards can be type M, M+, or H. Type M has an access time too slow to let the highest-quality video write to the card, so you can only record 10 seconds of video in this case. I contacted Olympus and they confirmed that the M+ and H type cards circumvent this problem, allowing you to fill the entire XD card with movie data if you wish to.

Reviews.Title: Olympus Digital Camera Review
Reviews.Author: Hadley Jane
Reviews.Content: This camera is a great buy! Everything you need comes in the package, except you'll have to buy an additional memory card (about $16 for 2GB).  It works great and takes good pictures at night, in action, or for everyday use. It's small to fit in your pocket and has a new, sleek look.  The settings are advanced and allow for every type of shooting.  As a college student, this is a perfect camera. I have had no problems with it thus far.

Reviews.Title: Olympus digital camera
Reviews.Author: EFD "French teach"
Reviews.Content: Good camera, very easy to use, very large screen. Only one flaw: the battery life is rather short and needs to be recharged quite often.

Reviews.Title: A camera with drawbacks
Reviews.Author: Mark Billings
Reviews.Content: I don't want to labor the points made by previous reviewers, but, the battery life is poor.  The lack of sound on video is also an irritation.  As someone else said, the picture quality isn't really that good; one shouldn't need to have the camera on the highest resolution possible to get just passable picture quality.Positives: Lightweight; compact; more than reasonable software bundle and easy to use.  Good zoom and image stabilization.  Easy to navigate menu.Negatives: Poor picture quality; non-standard memory card (have to mess with an adapter).  Preferred shooting mode does not seem to save; every time you power on, you are back to the default. No sound on video.  Poor battery life (it should not die from a full charge after shooting just 6 minutes of video).I persevered with this camera for a couple of months.  The bottom line for me was that the picture quality was much poorer than cameras very much older and far less expensive.  This is probably the first and last Olympus camera that I will ever own.I have since bought a Sony DSC-T90 and really, I could not be happier.  I just wished that I hadn't wasted money on the Olympus FE-3010.

Reviews.Title: Meh.
Reviews.Author: MD
Reviews.Content: Honestly my iPhone takes better pictures. I can't really recommend this to anyone, but it is pretty simple to use. I figured out every option in about 20 minutes, so it seems intuitive. However I would really get something else, I only have this because it was free.

Reviews.Title: Defective camera
Reviews.Author: Band Mom
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera for a teenager.  The pictures were very good; but the lens stopped retracting after 4 months of irregular use (my daughter took at most 150 pictures with the camera).  I sent it in for warranty (at the cost of $30.00) and was told the warranty was null and void due to tampering.  Olympus wants $72.00 to fix the camera.  My husband was with my daughter when it stopped working.  No one tampered with the product.  I'm not going to throw more money at this firm and I will never purchase a camera from this company again.

Reviews.Title: Image stabilization does not seem automatic
Reviews.Author: D. Berg
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to bring on a SCUBA diving vacation.  I bought the PT-046 waterproof housing to go with the camera.  I wanted a point and shoot camera.  This isn't a hard camera to use, but isn't really easy.  When this camera is turned on, it always starts in the auto snapshot mode.  Even in bright mid day sun, the shutter does not seem fast enough to capture a steady picture.  I have not had issues getting steady pictures with other cameras I've used.  If I remember to switch to the stabilzation mode, the pictures come out fine.  In macro mode, the issue is worse.  In super macro mode, I have difficulty getting a steady picture even if the camera is on a tripod.The flash works fairly well for 5-10 foot photos.  Beyond that, it seems to have trouble lighting the picture.  When diving, most pictures are taken in a macro mode.  I've found the flash to be too bright for close subjects, even with the diffuser built into the waterpfoof housing.The FE-3010 does take better pictures than my old Nikon Coolpix L3.  If this had not been able to beat a 3 year old camera (that disappointed me when it was new), I would have given this a 1 star rating.

Reviews.Title: Great Pictures
Reviews.Author: Lisa L. Boerger
Reviews.Content: After reviewing lots of other brands I decided to purchase another Olympus, as I have an old 3 meg. stylus. I am very impressed with the pictures this camera takes. We went on a motorcycle trip and I took pictures while on the bike and they turned out very clear while using the stablizing mode. I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Non-techies can use this easily!
Reviews.Author: K. Leigh "Traveler"
Reviews.Content: I have only recently joined the 21st century by buying a cell phone, computer and now a digital camera.  I wanted something that was, basically, point and shoot. It doesn't need an Olympus-only memory card. I didn't need anything fancy. This camera is so very easy to operate! The instructions were very straight-forward. I like the self timer and the pictures are sharp and colorful. I used the video to capture the sounds of a bunch of sheep baaing and it's one of my favorite images. I feel it was a great value and the pinkish color makes it fun!

Reviews.Title: get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Emily
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera when it was just out. It was cheap even then and that should have been a hint. To its credit, it is quite a sleek and small design which makes it really easy to carry around in a pocket. I used it to take a video of my boyfriend's band's gig. Didn't expect it to perform at all but you can actually make out the songs - not great quality, obviously - and the band members pretty clearly. Nothing amazing but good enough for YouTube.Unfortunately, for the couple of things this camera does well, it does many other things quite poorly. It takes so long to take a photo. You think it's taken and go to move your hand but it turns out it hasn't. Then you get a blurry shot and have to take it again. The auto and normal picture modes are alright, if somewhat overexposed. Try taking a photo of anything moving and you will get a lot of movement in the photo - as in I took a photo of my boyfriend playing guitar and he ended up with about 8 fingers on one hand. Unless you have an extremely steady hand it's likely you will get a blurry photo, as well. There is an image stabilisation mode but all of the photos in this turn out weird and unnatural looking.You have to take the battery out and put it in a little charger to recharge. This is kind of hit and miss as sometimes the charger doesn't recognise there's a battery in it and will need to be fiddled with. This can be annoying if you just leave it to charge before you need to use it. Also concerning the battery, the little spring which pops the battery in and out when you press it in has broken so it now only pops out. This is probably something unique to my camera. It might have gotten impacted although I'm not sure how as I'm fairly careful with it. However, it's just a point to consider that it's not the most rugged of cameras, either. It still works when you shut the door even though the battery doesn't click in correctly. Again, just annoying.If you don't care what your photos look like and don't mind having to take and retake them to get a good picture, I guess you could buy this. But as I said, you get what you pay for, which for me = annoying.

Reviews.Title: not the best...
Reviews.Author: Katie
Reviews.Content: The amount of time it takes for it to take its first picture after turning it on is way too long. The lens is really sensitive so make sure you keep it in a case otherwise it'll start to bend off. Overall, I wouldn't particularly recommend this camera if you're looking for a camera in this price range.

Reviews.Title: Olympus camera
Reviews.Author: Jan Kendrick "cosco27"
Reviews.Content: Gift for my daughter -- she loves it & uses it often.  I bought it because I was really pleased with the Olympus I'd bought a couple of years before.  Love Olympus & the price was 1/2 the price of mine I purchased in town & an upgraded version.

Reviews.Title: Execllent Beginner Camera
Reviews.Author: captainbrittany
Reviews.Content: I just recently bought an orange version from [...]. I've had it for a few weeks, and so far it's a decent camera. I bought it to replace my 4 year old Nikon Coolpix L4 (4 MP, 3x zoom), and the Olympus 3010 does a great job. The pictures are crisp and clear. It did take a bit more time to figure out what worked best in what type of setting on the Olympus than on my Nikon camera, but that's mainly because there are so many more options to get the perfect picture on the Olympus.The battery does seem to drain a bit faster on this camera than the batteries I used for my Nikon, but it's not that big of a difference. If you plan on taking any camera out for several hours, it's always a good idea to have back-up batteries, anyway.The size is what really makes me happy, though. This camera is very slim, and it easily fits into the cell phone pouch in all of my purses. It also doesn't weigh that much, which is nice because I love taking my camera everywhere with me, and I hated how heavy my old camera made my purse.Truth be told, I was very skeptical when I first thought about purchasing this camera, but now I love it. Overall, I would say that this would be a great camera for a first time buyer, or a person who just enjoys taking pictures, but isn't a serious photographer. I'm really quite happy and impressed with my camera.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Patricia E. Crowther
Reviews.Content: I love this camera for many reasons, I wish it had a see through window, as sometimes in the sun it is hard to see the view.  All in all I am very happy with this camera

Reviews.Title: great camera, buy it
Reviews.Author: A C "Antonio"
Reviews.Content: After buying cameras within this price range over the years, I finally got a camera that left me satisfied. Takes great pictures even if you don't know anything about photography and it's so slim it fits everywhere.

Reviews.Title: Great camera after you learn to use it!
Reviews.Author: gogirl
Reviews.Content: The first time I tried to use it, all the pictures came out blurry and I was really mad. Then I read the directions and saw you have to hold the button down halfway for awhile first to focus the image and then press all the way down. After that, the pictures come out fine. I'm kinda mad the camera doesn't have any sound for the video. Thats kinda primitive.

Reviews.Title: Not that easy to use and monotor broke 1 month later without explanation
Reviews.Author: lvlc "From Mom to Mom"
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a little than a month now. When I tried to take pictures in other modes than iAuto (which by the way every time you turn on the camera you have to manually set, very inconvenient), it gets busy from picture to picture so you can't take picture one after the other because you need to wait for the camera to stabilize again.I used the camera this weekend with some friends. It took beautiful pictures. I showed to a friend, put the camera in its case away (in a basket at home) and the next day I grabbed it to take a picture and found out that the monitor was cracked, like it fell down, but the outside was brand new. It looks like its inside the camera, half the screen is white and black and I can see just a little of what the lens is seeing (say 1/4 of the monitor). No body has access to this camera other than me. And I am sure I didn't break it. I just put it away in its case! and out of nowhere the LCD is broken?I called the repair number and I need to send it for repair, but I don't think the warranty is going to cover it. They will clearly state that it was dropped and was broken on impact, to can't proof otherwise!FRUSTRATING! $150 in the trash in a month! and I can't do anything about it! I read somewhere that this happened to someone else and I can't believe it happened to me!Will definitely not buy this one again. My experience with Olympus has been good but after this, I might think it twice!

Reviews.Title: Piece of Crap!!!
Reviews.Author: Mermaid Girl
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera about a year ago.  The first time I used it I took it to the Budweiser Invitational Horse Show.  The shutter speed is so slow all I got was pictures of the back end of horses going over jumps!!  Took it on vacation over Christmas & the Digital screen is messed up.  It still takes pictures, you just can't see what you took or download them from the camera.

Reviews.Title: Sleek design but...
Reviews.Author: Jen
Reviews.Content: The camera has a nice, sleek design but the quality of photos didn't seem "up to par" to me. I previously had an Olympus Fe-xxxx which I absolutely loved. Unfortunately, I dropped it on the floor a few times and it eventually broke (No warranty as I had it for over 2 years) So, thinking that the Olympus cameras had a good reputation, I bought the same camera--just a few models up-- and expected the camera to be just as nice...I took the camera with me to a party and was disappointed. I am taking the camera back tomorrow and getting a Panasonic or Canon instead. Some may like, but I feel differently. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: Think Twice or atleast buy a good carrying case with it.
Reviews.Author: Jeff Johnson "PCmediaHost"
Reviews.Content: I bought this Olympus FE-3010 camera and 2 weeks later the screen broke. I am not even sure how. I did have it in my pocket for about 10 minutes, but I dont remember running into anything. I have carried my Samsung slider phone in my pocket for years, and even bounced it off the sidewalk a few times and it never broke. I think the the camera itself is just generic.From the time I did have with it....I didnt like the fact the zoom always had to be out when it was on. It would have made it too easy to bump into things....and if you just wanted to keep it on, just in case you wanted to capture something, it made it really akward. You could just turn it off but by the time the camera powers up you would have missed your shot.The first day I noticed software issues as well. The camera would freeze up and you would have to power it off and turn it back on, in order to get it to work again.I wasn't too impressed with the Zoom either...It seemed like it was more of a 3x optical blur. I havnt been able to check the 12 MP image quality yet as I have no screen to see the menu, in order for me to get the images off my new $150 paperwieght.Regards.

ProductInfo.Features:
12-megapixel resolution for photo-quality, poster-size prints
3x optical zoom; Advanced Face Detection
2.7-inch LCD screen; Intelligent Auto and Pre-set Shooting modes
Super-slim (0.7-inch thick) metal body
Compatible with xD Picture Cards and microSD memory cards (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Olympus FE-3010 12MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom and 2.7 Inch LCD (Titanium)
